info.name: Legado Digital Vault API Copy 2
info.description:
## Digital Vault API

The Digital Vault API provides the functionality for the digital vault.  An SSO token is required to provide the user context for the majority of method calls.

### Authentication

In order to make calls to the Vault API, it is necessary to use a combination of API Key and SSO Token. 

These values should be provided in the headers:

*   API Key (header parameter ApiKey)  identifies the corporate platform.
*   Subscription Key (header parameter subscription-key) is the key which identifies the calling application.

For any method call which requires authentication, a bearer token must be attached to the request header as well.

In local development, or in the Dev and QA environments, its possible to get a token for any email address just by calling this:

```plaintext
/api/auth?email=<email>
```

This will not work in pre-prod and production.  A genuine token must be provided from the calling application.

If the calling application is set up to provide a token in exchange for a one-time use code, then this can be acheved by calling this method:

```plaintext
/api/auth/token?code=<code>
```

The token will be configured with a short time to live - for example 15 minutes, but this will vary depending on the settings of the calling application. Any UI which uses this API needs to keep the token refreshed for the duration of the session.  This can be done by calling the refresh method:

```plaintext
/api/auth/refresh
```

Simply attaching the existing bearer token will get a new one for the same user.  The Api Key specified will result in looking up the SSO settings for the host platform.

### Loading the Vault

Once the authentication process is complete, the current user can be identified by calling the “get user” method:

```plaintext
/api/user/get
```

The full folder and file structure can be obtained by calling the “get node list” method.

```plaintext
/api/node/getnodelist?contents=true
```


Contact Support:
 Name: Legado Technologies Ltd
 Email: api@joinlegado.com
